I would prefer complex to simple problems.
I like to have the responsibility of handling a situation that requires a lot of thinking.
Thinking is not my idea of fun.
I would rather do something that requires little thought than something that is sure to challenge my thinking abilities.
I really enjoy a task that involves coming up with new solutions to problems.
I would prefer a task that is intellectual, difficult, and important to one that is somewhat important but does not require much thought.
I have a logical mind.
I prefer complex problems to simple problems.
I am not a very analytical thinker.
I don't reason well under pressure.
I have no problem thinking things through carefully.
I believe in trusting my hunches.
I trust my initial feelings about people.
I like to rely on my intuitive impressions.
I don't like situations in which I have to rely on intuition.
Intuition can be a very useful way to solve problems.
I feel uncomfortable when I don't know what to expect in a situation.
I find it difficult to make decisions when information is unclear or incomplete.
I prefer situations where I have all the details clearly laid out.
Uncertain social situations make me feel anxious.
I get frustrated when things are ambiguous or unclear.
I need clear instructions before I feel comfortable starting a task.
I find it stressful when I cannot predict the outcome of a situation.
